article.title: Optimal-Time Text Indexing in BWT-runs Bounded Space

choices: The relationship between the suffix array (SA) and the Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT).
The construction of a Run-Length FM-index.
The relationship between phrases in the Inverse Suffix Array (ISA) and runs in the Suffix Array (SA).
The application of Locally Consistent Parsing on the Differential Suffix Array (DSA).

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula is used to simulate which operation in the Run-Length FM-index?
choices: Counting the occurrences of a pattern.
Locating the occurrences of a pattern.
Extracting a substring of the text.
The time and space complexity of different algorithms for sorting strings.
The performance of different self-indexes for repetitive text collections.
The comparison of different grammar compression methods for text.
The lower bounds for random access to grammar-compressed strings.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is NOT a contribution listed in Table 2?
choices: Optimal count time in the packed setting.
Optimal locate time in the unpacked setting.
Efficient extraction of substrings within O(r) space.
Compressed suffix tree with space bounded in terms of r.
